name: Karl-Christian Wolff-Ingham

hero.tagline: Design and product leadership with technical savvy

summary:
Senior leader bridging design, product, and technology to drive enterprise-scale digital transformation and measurable business growth. Proven track record building and maturing UX organizations, establishing design as strategic capability, innovating with emerging technologies and delivering customer-centric solutions that generate ROI across Fortune companies.

Unique combination of technical fluency (patents, BS Computer Science), human-centered design expertise (MS HCI), and business acumen (MBA Brown/IE) enables strategic vision with hands-on execution. Experience spans media, finance, e-commerce, and consulting sectors, consistently translating complex customer needs into innovative products that drive competitive advantage.

keyAchievements.heading: Driving Business Growth Through Design Leadership
items: Leading design for digital transformation of <hotspot key="gpc-revenue">$8B e-commerce platform at Global Fortune automotive parts distribution leader</hotspot>, delivering 7% add-to-cart improvement representing $32.8M lift in revenue (2025) for Pro product.

Led product and design for innovative quantified self, health and wellness product — upwave, growing it from zero to 1M monthly unique users, 27K registered users, and 9.5M visits in 8 months, earning Webby nomination.

keyAchievements.heading: Building & Scaling Design Organizations
items: Established design and research as strategic function at GPC, reporting to CIO and transforming multi-billion-dollar e-commerce platform.
Scaled SunTrust design team prior to largest banking merger since 2008 ($66B) and positioned design as strategic differentiator.
Led and transformed UX practice for North Highland, serving <hotspot key="clients">Delta, Coca-Cola, T-Mobile, Disney, Universal Studios, Home Depot</hotspot> and other Fortune companies
Built "Bolt" global design system adopted across North America, Europe, and APAC.

keyAchievements.heading: Innovation Leadership & Strategic Foresight
items: Rebooted and led Innovation Studio at SunTrust and then partnered with Corporate Strategy to explore future of banking through strategic foresight, delivering CEO and C-suite presentation that shaped organizational vision and subsequent merger.
Led R&D function at Turner Broadcasting exploring emerging platforms and technologies, resulting in Emmy Award-winning products and two granted patents in automatic content recognition.
Pioneered interactive broadcast technologies including CNN "Magic Wall" and sync-to-TV platforms that redefined industry standards for data storytelling and audience engagement.

experience.title: Senior Director & Head of UX Design and Research · Atlanta, GA
experience.description: Executive design leader leading UX design and research for Fortune Global 500 automotive/industrial parts distribution leader.
bullets: Leading research-driven redesign of $8B unified commerce platform and <hotspot key="agentic">AI-driven (agentic) internal venture</hotspot>, informed by prior consulting engagement.
Developed <hotspot key="bolt">"Bolt" global design system</hotspot> adopted across North America, Europe, and APAC.
Introduced balanced team model embedding dedicated design and research roles in agile pods, supported by a scalable design process integrating stakeholder engagement and user research.
Pioneered early 2025 assessment of and subsequent introduction of AI design and prototyping tool (v0) to optimize for exploration breadth and execution speed.

experience.title: Founder & Principal Consultant · Atlanta, GA
experience.description: Boutique product and design consultancy bridging strategy and execution for clients across fitness, media analytics, and automotive sectors.
bullets: Conducted yearlong strategic foresight engagement for GPC CIO on the future of automotive retail and repair - including primary research and journey mapping across drivers, repair shops, parts stores, and supply chain. Work directly informed the company's digital transformation roadmap and led to recruitment as Head of UX Design and Research.
Redesigned FitRadio's workout music streaming app. Product coaching for Comscore. Mobile app redesign for Gold's Gym.

experience.company: TRUIST (SunTrust prior to SunTrust BB&T Merger)
experience.title: Head of UX Design & Research · Atlanta, GA
experience.description: Inherited small nascent UX design team (SunTrust) with no research or UI capability and no independent design voice. Scaled to 30-person multidisciplinary team and established evidence-based design methodology through the SunTrust-BB&T merger.
bullets: Rebooted and repositioned the <hotspot key="merger">SunTrust Innovation Accelerator Studio</hotspot>, introducing service design, customer journey mapping and strategic foresight as core capabilities. Partnered with Corporate Strategy on a foresight exercise - presenting three future-of-banking scenarios to CEO and C-Suite; CEO called the work "instrumental" in shaping merger strategy.
Led UX design and research across Consumer Banking, Small Business, Wealth Management, Small Business and Commercial Banking for SunTrust and Small Business and Commercial Banking for Truist.
Rebuilt all <hotspot key="truist-products">product experiences</hotspot> for the merged entity. Integrating design and voice of the customer into Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe).
Translated the new Truist brand into visual design and UI standards, defining the Truist design system deployed across all digital products.

experience.title: UX Design Practice Leader, Experience Design · Atlanta, GA
experience.description: Led UX and emerging interactions practice for Sparks Grove, North Highland's design and innovation agency. Served Fortune 500 clients including Delta Air Lines, The Coca-Cola Company, Disney, Universal Studios, T-Mobile, and The Home Depot.
bullets: Led transformation of agency from traditional waterfall delivery to agile software development and lean product management — repositioning the practice around "Human Experience Design" (HxD). Earned National Impact Award (2016) for the transformation.

Key engagements included building <hotspot key="delta">news.delta.com</hotspot> for Delta Air Lines and consulting with The Home Depot for lean product development and design in their enterprise product organization.

experience.title: Vice President, Product & UX · Atlanta, GA
experience.description: Led product management and product design for <hotspot key="upwave">upwave</hotspot>, Turner's IoT- driven digital health venture at the intersection of quantified-self technologies (wearables, health trackers) and personalized content delivery. Partnered with IDEO on initial market validation and product-market fit.
bullets: Took venture from concept to 1M monthly unique users, 27K registered users, and 9.5M visits in 8 months. Introduced lean product methodology enabling daily release cycles, and increased site recirculation from 5% to 24%.
Product nominated for Webby Award (Health & Fitness). Venture was ahead of mainstream wearables adoption (pre-Apple Watch) and sunset when Turner exited the health vertical.

experience.title: Senior Director, Innovation & Emerging Technology · Atlanta, GA
experience.description: Led multi-disciplinary (Product, UX, Engineering) R&D team driving innovation across emerging platforms for CNN, Cartoon Network, TBS, and TNT.
bullets: Contributed to an <hotspot key="emmy">Emmy Award</hotspot> (Outstanding Creative Achievement in Interactive Media) by developing the underlying automatic content recognition (ACR) platform that powered the Team Coco sync-to-TV application.
Granted two <hotspot key="patents">U.S. patents</hotspot> for automatic content recognition and audience engagement technologies that synchronized interactive content with live broadcast television.

Designed and led development for CNN World Cup Twitter Buzz, producing realtime data visualization that earned a <hotspot key="rts-award">Royal Television Society Award</hotspot> and Fast Company's "Infographic of the Day".
Co-designed the large-format multi-touch <hotspot key="magicwall">CNN "Magic Wall"</hotspot>, pioneering data-driven storytelling for election coverage and establishing a new industry paradigm.

experience.title: Director, Games & Entertainment Technology · Atlanta, GA
experience.description: R&D exploration role focused on piloting and promoting emerging platforms into Turner Brands (CNN, Cartoon Network, TBS, TNT)prior to mainstream adoption.
bullets: Pioneered the first <hotspot key="ar">mobile augmented reality applications</hotspot> in the U.S. for NBA and Cartoon Network in an academic partnership with Georgia Tech. Built on pre-iPhone Nokia devices, successfully predicting mobile's path to AR dominance.
Established virtual item sales as an incremental revenue stream for Cartoon Network and Adult Swim properties on Sony PlayStation Home's early virtual economies.
Prototyped early cloud streaming games technology for GameTap using instant-on video technology. Pre-cursor to cloud gaming services like Google Stadia and Nvidia GeForce Now.

experience.title: Interactive TV Architect · Portland, OR / London, UK
experience.description: Ensequence was the dominant interactive TV software platform from the US, powering interactive shows and commercials across more than 20 million homes worldwide. Client roster included NBCUniversal, ESPN, MTV Networks, HBO, BSkyB, BBC.
bullets: UK product manager for the "on-Q" Interactive TV Authoring System.
Designed, engineered, and deployed solutions and applications for broadcast deployments for major clients.

experience.title: Solutions Development Manager · London, UK
experience.description: Founding team member of Two Way TV, a world-leading interactive television pioneer that operated dedicated gaming channels across the UK's major digital platforms and internationally in the US/Canada and Australia. The company held key interactive TV patents, and signed a strategic alliance with Microsoft to bring the technology to the MSTV platform.
bullets: Produced "Armchair Manager – Football," earning a <hotspot key="bafta">BAFTA Interactive Entertainment Award</hotspot> Nomination (2000) for realtime interactive sports broadcasting.
Pioneered the first interactive television multiplayer game service globally via the Challenge TV network on Sky.

education.school: Brown University & IE Business School, US & Spain
education.focus: Focus: Strategic management, innovation, and global business
Focus: Human Computer InteractionAI and Intelligent Tutoring Systems. <hotspot key="apple-award">Apple Design Project Award</hotspot> winner.
Dissertation: <hotspot key="dissertation">"Colonizing Cyberspace"</hotspot>. Built <hotspot key="backprop">neural network capabilities</hotspot> for HyperCard.
